Job Title: Sr. Analyst - Pricing & Pack-Price Architecture

Location: Ewing, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
A collective energy and ambition. A place where you can make a real difference.

We're a company that genuinely cares about our people, our products, our consumers and the environment.

Our unique, informal culture champions courage, determination and collaboration. Knowing we have an open and supportive team means each of us has the freedom to take responsibility and ownership. We have a shared passion to work hard, innovate and push boundaries.

United by the belief that when we strive for growth, anything is possible. While we might not be the largest company in our industry, we believe we can have the biggest impact because: Together We Have the Power to Win.

Hybrid

Role Summary

Support the Revenue Growth Management (RGM) team in developing pricing and price-pack architecture (PPA) strategies that align to brand strategies to maximize revenue, market share and profitability. You will partner closely with the business unit teams to support the pricing strategy recommendations that are grounded in analytical rigor, drive value creation and deliver on portfolio and P&L objectives.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Support the Pricing Managers with analyses leveraging Circana/POS, Panel/Shopper and Financial data to optimize PPADevelop a deep understanding of pricing (price positioning, price slopes, elasticities, price tiers, thresholds, etc) in support of analyses and recommendationsSupport New Product Development and Market Research teams in setting price and promotional strategies for innovation; provide input requirements for analyses and research needsPartner with in-house Analytics team and Analytics/Research suppliers to scope out and develop tools and research that advances Revenue Growth Management capabilities and insightsContinually monitor and report on category and competitive activities (pricing, promo, sizing/assortment, etc) to identify risks / opportunitiesMonitor pricing execution and perform robust post-pricing analysis to measure actuals versus expectationsContribute in delivering RGM training, incorporating case studies with best practice sharing

Skills / Experience / Competencies:

Bachelor's degree required (Preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field)Master's degree in Business, Analytics or Finance is a plus3-5 years in CPG or Consulting with Pricing, Trade, Category Management or Business Analytics experienceStrong competence in syndicated data, panel insights, and TPM/TPO systemsStrong competence in MS Excel, PowerPoint and PowerBIStrong analytical skills with strong financial / P&L acumenCollaborate cross-functionally with brand, sales, finance and other key internal/external stakeholders;Self-motivated, ability to manage multiple priorities; excels in a fast-paced environment

#piq

Church & Dwight is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

For more information on our company, our brands and our culture visit us at http://www.churchdwight.com/PandoLogic. Keywords: Cost Analyst, Location: EWING, NJ - 08629

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
